Description/Significance: Context and summary info for all facilities
Federal level inspections only.

Discharge monitoring reports submitted by industry for FY20 (but really, calendar year?) Includes detailed info on whether permit levels were exceeded and by how much. Also whether reports were missing.
Effluent violations of the CWA (i.e. you reported too much of pollutant X in the water)
Records of formal enforcement actions taken under the CWA e.g. civil penalties
State/Federal inspections under the CWA
CWA permit schedule violations (i.e. you didn't do X thing required of your permit)
Summary of the 4 different possible CWA violations: effluent, permit, compliance schedule, and single event
Single event violations of the CWA (i.e. you reported a single event where you dumped too much of pollutant X in the water)
Annual summary of industry-reported air emissions from different programs (TRI, GGHRP, etc.) Includes ability to filter by GHG, Hazardous Air Pollutants, Criteria Air Pollutants
Records of formal AND informal actions taken under RCRA

Violations of RCRA

Description/Significance: Data on inspections (by EPA). Can be broken down by date, region, law, type of monitoring/inspection.
Contains ACTIVITY_ID and REGISTRY_ID to join case information to databases on facilities

Aggregate enforcement metrics allowing counts of different types of enforcement actions taken by EPA (espeically civil administrative vs. civil judicial); penalties; compliance costs; SEP; cost recovery from CERCLA. Can be broken down by enforcement type, region, law, time period
Notes/Questions: Check if data from this source matches that already in "nationwide statistics" notebook (e.g., number of CWA enforcement actions)

Description/Significance: Informal enforcement actions (letters, phone calls). EPA has made this a cornerstone of new approach under Trump, but has lacked good informal enforcement statistics. Recently, directed regions to standardize and collect better informal enforcement action data.

Data on estimated reductions/preventions through enforcement. Broken down by pollutant, media (air, water, soil), SEP or compliance. Could do by region and by law by joining with CASE_ENFORCEMENTS_CONCLUSIONS
